summary.accuracy_assessment: 86% - Multiple missing options and misleading sections

findings.issue: SKILL.md lines 139-145 include resolve in 'Dry Run Support' section claiming '--dry-run' is supported, but actual CLI help shows only '-r/--resolution' and '-c/--comment' options. No --dry-run available.
findings.documented_in_skill: Line 139 (Dry Run Support section lists resolve)
findings.impact: User will get error if they try 'jira-as lifecycle resolve PROJ-123 --dry-run'
findings.recommendation: Remove resolve command from Dry Run Support section (lines 139-145) or implement --dry-run in CLI

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 139 includes reopen in 'Dry Run Support' section, but actual CLI help shows only '-c/--comment' option. No --dry-run available.
findings.impact: User will get error if they try 'jira-as lifecycle reopen PROJ-123 --dry-run'
findings.recommendation: Remove reopen command from Dry Run Support section or implement --dry-run in CLI

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 62 documents transitions command without noting it supports '--output' flag. CLI shows '-o, --output [text|json]' option available.
findings.documented_in_skill: Line 62: 'jira-as lifecycle transitions PROJ-123  # List available transitions' (no mention of --output)
findings.impact: User may not discover output format option
findings.recommendation: Update line 62 example to show: 'jira-as lifecycle transitions PROJ-123 --output json' or add to Common Options section with clarity on supported formats

findings.issue: SKILL.md lines 90-92 document --unreleased and --archived flags but missing '--output' option which supports 'table' or 'json' formats
findings.impact: User cannot discover JSON output capability from documentation
findings.recommendation: Add example: 'jira-as lifecycle version list PROJ --output json' to lines 90-92 or Common Options section

findings.issue: SKILL.md lines 74-77 document assign command without '--dry-run' option, but CLI supports '-n, --dry-run' flag
findings.impact: Inconsistency - Dry Run Support section (line 139-145) shows assign command example with --dry-run, but assign command section doesn't document it
findings.recommendation: Add assign examples to lines 74-77 that show --dry-run support, OR at minimum ensure consistency between sections

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 108 documents component list without noting '--output' option for 'table' or 'json' formats
findings.documented_in_skill: Line 108: 'jira-as lifecycle component list PROJ  # List components (shows IDs)' (no mention of --output)
findings.impact: User cannot discover JSON output capability from documentation
findings.recommendation: Add example: 'jira-as lifecycle component list PROJ --output json' to line 108 or Common Options section

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 139-145 includes 'version archive' in Dry Run Support section, but actual CLI shows no --dry-run option
findings.documented_in_skill: Line 139-145 (Dry Run Support section) does NOT list archive specifically but implies all version/component commands support it
findings.actual_cli_help: No --dry-run option in 'jira-as lifecycle version archive --help'
findings.impact: User may assume --dry-run works for archive when it doesn't
findings.recommendation: Clarify in Dry Run Support section which specific commands support --dry-run: transition, assign, version create, component create/update/delete (NOT resolve, reopen, or archive)

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 95 shows date examples from 2025 (2025-01-01, 2025-03-01), which are now in the past as of review date 2026-01-31
findings.impact: Example dates are outdated/confusing to current users
findings.recommendation: Update line 95 to use forward-looking dates: '--start-date 2026-02-01 --release-date 2026-04-01' or make example date-agnostic

findings.issue: SKILL.md line 97 shows 'jira-as lifecycle version create PROJ --name "v2.0.0" --archived' but this option is not documented in lines 88-101 (Version Management section)
findings.documented_in_skill: Line 97 uses --archived flag without documenting it earlier in the section
findings.actual_cli_help: CLI supports: --released, --archived flags (seen in version create --help)
findings.impact: User discovers --archived in example but not in explanatory text
findings.recommendation: Add --archived flag to version create documentation with explanation: 'Create version as archived immediately' (similar to --released)

immediate: Fix Dry Run Support section (lines 139-145) to remove resolve and reopen if --dry-run is not actually supported
high: Add --dry-run to assign command documentation for consistency
medium: Update date examples in line 95 to use current year (2026) or relative descriptions
Document --archived flag in version create section
